article: It is hard to decide which food to buy in an American grocery store these days.The information on many products makes41 _ claims.The label " organic" _ that the United States Department of Agriculture recognizes the product is grown under special conditions.If the food is grown in this way , it shows the words "USDA organic" on it.This is an official label. The food is grown without chemical treatment against insects or _ . It is grown without chemical fertilizers.Before a product is labeled " organic ,"a(n)45 _ visits the farm where the food is produced to make sure the farm _ SDA standards.Organic meat , eggs and dairy products come from _ that are given no antibiotics , must be fed organic food and have _ to the outdoors. No conclusive _ shows that organic food is more nutritious than traditionally grown food. And the USDA --even if it proves organic food --doesn't _ declare that these products are safer or more nutritious. Organic foods meet the same _ and safety standards as traditional foods. The difference lies in how the food is produced , processed and handled.Some people buy organic food for _ reasons. Organic food is produced by _ who emphasize the use of renewable resources. The prices between most organic food and _ good products vary. Higher prices are due to more expensive farm _ . A lot of work must be done every day. The new USDA' s national organic programme for labeling is _ to enabling consumers to make a(n) _ choice among the foods they buy and have the _ of the safeguard of being cheated.People who sell or label a product " organic" when they know it does not meet USDA standards can be _ up to $11 ,000.
